questions.text: Which structure carries axons from the nucleus gracilis to the thalamus?

A 15 year child has a limp in in his left leg. Clinically there is some swelling in the lower thigh. An X ray shows a codman trangle. Biopsy from the tumor is as shown in the image, the tumor cells show a translocation 11;22. What is the likely diagnosis?

questions.text: A child 8 years old, presents in the emergency department after ingesting multiple tablets accidentally. questions.text: A hypertensive patient was brought to the emergency due to complaints of palpitations and breathing difficulty. Comment on his ECG.

A 24-year-old female is admitted with palpitations. Her pulse is 220 beats/min, blood pressure 70/50 mmHg and she has a respiratory rate 32/min. She is awake, alert and oriented but dyspnoeic. Her electrocardiogram shows a regular rhythm with QRS complex width of 0.11 s. What is the most appropriate therapy for this patient?

A 66-year-old man with insulin-dependent diabetes given ibuprofen for a knee injury is admitted with palpitations. His ECG shows a rate of 105 beats per minute, with absent P waves and tall T waves. His urea and electrolytes show: Na:132 mmol/L, K+: 6.4 mmol/L, Urea 11 mmol/L, Creatinine 180 pmol/L. In this scenario, which of the following is the most appropriate immediate management?

A 63-year-old male is admitted with a 30 minute history of central chest pain associated with nausea and sweating. His ECG reveals ST elevation in leads Il, Ill, and aVF. Which of the following coronary arteries is most likely to be occluded?
Deficiency of which one of the following trace elements is implicated as a cause of cardiomyopathy?

What is the probable diagnosis for a patient who has symptoms of frequent urination, nocturia, and enuresis, along with a 24-hour urine volume of 7 liters, a urine osmolarity of 260 mOsm/L, an ADH assay result of 0.8 pg/ml, and a brain MRI showing no bright spot on T1 weighted images?
A hepatitis B positive person came to your opd on routine urine, massive proteinuria (> 3.5 g/day), Further renal biopsy was performed. identify the disease?
A young man presents with the following painful, soft ulcer, 4 days after unprotected sexual intercourse. Which of the following will you choose as initial treatment for this patient?
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Incorrect Options:
  • • Option (A) Ceftriaxone 500 mg IM stat
  • • Explanation: Ceftriaxone is an effective treatment for chancroid, and a single intramuscular (IM) dose is a recommended approach. However, the standard recommended dose is usually 250 mg IM. While a 500 mg dose would likely be effective, it is higher than the typically cited standard single dose, making Azithromycin 1g oral (which is a standard recommended dose) a more precise choice among the options.
  • • Option (B) Ciprofloxacin 500 mg BD for 4 days
  • • Explanation: Ciprofloxacin 500 mg orally twice daily (BD) is a recommended treatment for chancroid, but the standard duration is for 3 days. While a 4-day course would likely be effective, it deviates from the standard recommended multi-dose regimen and is less preferable than a single-dose regimen like Azithromycin for initial treatment when compliance is a consideration.
  • • Option (C) Erythromycin 500 mg QID for 7 days
  • • Explanation: Erythromycin base 500 mg orally is a recommended treatment for chancroid, but the standard dosing is typically three times a day (TID) for 7 days. QID (four times a day) is a higher frequency than standard and, being a multi-dose regimen over 7 days, it is generally less preferred than a single-dose therapy for initial treatment due to potential compliance issues.

questions.text: What should be done if a woman misses one combined oral contraceptive pill?

options.label: A
options.text: Skip the missed pill and take the next pill as scheduled

options.label: B
options.text: Take the missed pill as soon as remembered and continue the rest as scheduled

options.label: C
options.text: Stop the pills and wait for the next cycle

options.label: D
options.text: Take two pills immediately and continue as normal

questions.correct_answer: B. Take the missed pill as soon as remembered and continue the rest as scheduled

questions.text: A pregnant woman at 36 weeks of gestation with a prosthetic valve replacement for mitral stenosis is on warfarin therapy. Her INR is 3. What is the appropriate next step in management?

options.label: D
options.text: Stop warfarin, start LMWH and asprin

questions.correct_answer: A. Stop warfarin and start LMWH

questions.text: A 27-year-old female patient was found to have uterus didelphys. Which of the following is not likely to be a complication of this uterine anomaly?
The ultrasound of a young woman with infertility is suggestive of a uterine anomaly. Which of the following is used to confirm the diagnosis?
A 26-year-old pregnant woman, on examination was found to have infra-umbilical flattening. The fetal heart sounds were heard over the lateral side. What could be the fetal presentation/position?
A 28-year old pregnant woman came for a routine antenatal check-up in her second trimester. Four years back, she delivered 2 healthy full-term twins. What would her obstetric score be?
A 30-year-old woman on oral contraceptives for the past 6 months presents with 6 weeks of amenorrhea. What would be the best method of assessing the gestational age of this patient?
questions.correct_answer: A. Crown rump length by USG

questions.text: A 32-year-old G1P1 woman presents with an 8-month history of amenorrhea. A pregnancy test is negative. TSH and prolactin levels are normal. The FSH level is elevated at 40 IU/L. Which of the following is the most likely complication for this patient

options.label: A
options.text: She is at significant risk for endometrial cancer

options.label: B
options.text: She is at increased risk for ovarian cancer

options.label: C
options.text: She is at increased risk for osteoporosis

options.label: D
options.text: She is at increased risk for multiple gestations

questions.correct_answer: C. She is at increased risk for osteoporosis

questions.text: A 20-year-old G0P0 woman is told by her doctor that there is a strong probability that her gonads will turn malignant. She has not had her menses yet. She has Tanner stage I breast development. Which of the following describes the most likely diagnosis?
A patient with suspected tubal pregnancy underwent transvaginal ultrasound which was inconclusive. What is the next step of management?
A 58-year-old woman is being evaluated for bleeding per vagina. She attained menopause at the age of 47. Which of the following is least likely to be a cause of post- menopausal bleeding?
A patient comes to you with a history of unprotected sex 96 hours ago. Which of the following emergency contraceptives can be used in this case?
Arrange the sequence of lactation in the right order 1. Mammogenesis 2. Lactogenesis 3. Galactokinesis 4. Galactopoiesis

A patient presents with constant leakage of urine and is diagnosed to have a genital fistula. Methylene blue swab test is done and the upper swab gets stained. Which of the following is the most likely type of fistula in this patient?
Which of the following methods is most commonly used for the treatment of CIN?

options.label: B
options.text: Large loop excision of transformation zone (LLETZ)

questions.correct_answer: B. Large loop excision of transformation zone (LLETZ)

questions.text: Which among the following HPV serotypes is most commonly associated with Ca cervix?

A 28-year-old infertile male underwent semen analysis. Results show: sperm concentration - 16 million/ml: pH7.5: volume - 2 mL: no agglutination is seen. Morphology shows 60% normal and 60% motile sperms. The most likely diagnosis would be:
The day on which FSH levels are studied to detect the premenopausal stage is:
questions.correct_answer: A. Day 2-5 after last menstrual period

questions.text: Which of the following is the endocrinological change of PCOD?

options.label: C
options.text: Fasting insulin is more than 10 mIU/L

questions.text: Fibroid uterus may present with all of the following features except:
A 26-year-old woman is evaluated for primary infertility. Hysterosalpingography was done and reveals the finding shown below. What is the anomaly seen in the image?

A 19-year-old girl was brought by her mother to the outpatient department with primary amenorrhea. She had normal breast development and pubic hair. On examination, the vagina was blind-ending and the uterus was not palpable. What is the most probable diagnosis?
You are an intern posted in the postnatal ward of a hospital. You receive an HIV-positive patient on PND-1. Which of the following tests would you use to detect HIV in the baby?
A 9-month-old child was brought with frontal bossing and craniotabes. X-ray of the child showed widening of the wrist joint. Which of the following is least likely to be seen in this child?
A 2-week old infant with a birth weight of 1.8 Kg is being treated in the NICU for necrotizing enterocolitis. Which of the following statements is false regarding this disease?

options.label: A
options.text: Proximal part of the ileum is involved most frequently

options.label: C
options.text: It is associated with intestinal ischemia

options.label: D
options.text: It is more common in preterm infants

questions.correct_answer: A. Proximal part of the ileum is involved most frequently

questions.text: A young infant is brought to you with a suspected developmental delay. The child is intently looking at his own hands. You would consider referring this child to a specialist if this milestone persists after.
During the anthropometric evaluation, the height for age of a child is < - 2SD. This is most likely due to?
Which one of the following is not a feature in cerebral palsy?
A child in your unit is diagnosed with severe acute malnutrition (SAM). According to the WHO criteria, SAM is defined best by:
questions.correct_answer: D. Weight for height less than - 3SD

questions.text: While you are evaluating a baby, you show him a bright pink teddy bear, that he reaches out to with both hands. What is the earliest age by which this milestone is typically achieved?

A baby assessed 5 minutes after birth, is found to be cyanosed with irregular gasping respiration. Heart rate is 60 beats/min, and a grimace is seen with some flexion of extremities. The Apgar score for this newborn is

A 10-day old female neonate with hypoxic-ischemic encephalopathy is hyper-alert with mydriasis. Examination shows hyperactive tendon reflexes and clonus. On investigations, a normal EEG is obtained. What stage of HIE is she in?
Which numbered arrow indicates the lentiform nucleus?
A 9-year-old female child with history of head ache and visual disturbance. A CT image revealed a calcified solidcystic suprasellar lesion as show here. What could be your possible diagnosis?
A 20 year old male with h/o RTA presents with chest pain and dyspnea. eFAST was done and is sign of:.
A 12 week old child presented with fever, cyanosis and fatigue. His chest X ray is shown below. What is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.correct_answer: A. Total anomalous pulmonary venous circulation

questions.text: A gallium-67 scan was performed on a patient and showed the following. What is the diagnosis?
